title: Installing DeepLabCut on Windows 10, can't run testscript.py
body:
OS: Windows 10
DeepLabCut Version: 2.2rc1
Anaconda env used: DLC-CPU

Hi, I'm using deeplabcut as part of a student project.

I have been trying to install deeplabcut on windows 10 (nvidia geforce RTX 2080) using either gpu or cpu, but I have been having issues trying to run the testscript.py file.
Initially, when I set up my conda environment using the DLC-CPU.yaml file, I tried running the testscript.py and had the known error found here: https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/issues/1106 . 
It was resolved by following the conda install -c conda-forge ffmpeg advice. 
Then I got a new error similar to this one: https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/issues/1265 . And so now I am stuck trying to upgrade the deeplabcut version from ‘2.1.10.4’ to ‘2.2rc1’. 
After upgrading to 2.2rc1 using pip install and trying to import deeplabcut, then I get what is shown in the screenshot below.
I've also tried running ./reinstall.sh file, but it didn't work for windows so I've also tried directly running the following:
pip uninstall deeplabcut 
python setup.py sdist bdist_wheel
pip install C:\Users\LabMi\Documents\GitHub\DeepLabCut\dist\deeplabcut-2.2rc1-py3-none-any.whl 
However, I get the same error with import deeplabcut

What can I do?
I’ve tried upgrading different ways, but I always get the same error.
Has someone been able to install deeplabcut on windows 10 and can show their steps for an updated clean walk through, with or without gpu?

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/71452451/120266584-3e2a0900-c270-11eb-85b9-dc6b9ea9ef84.png)

Thank you so much for any help.
